summary:
I am an Educational and Developmental Psychologist, specialising in advice around students with challenging behaviours in the Primary school setting.
I have Masters Degrees in Developmental Psychology Tilburg, 1984) and Educational Pyschology (Tilburg, 1987) and a PhD in Social Sciences from Tilburg University (Emotional Meaning in Large Body Movements).<br>I worked for over 25 years with children and adolescents with challenging behaviours, in residential and educational settings. For more than 20 years I was a Psychologist in the Behaviour Service provided by the Ministry of Education of New Zealand.<br>I draw inspiration of the work and ideas of such practicioners as John mcGhee and Jacques Heycoop, as well as current insights from trauma informed practice and attachment research.<br>I am available for advice to school settings around managing and changing challenging and/or risk behaviour. I work primarily from a systems perspective, based on assessment of student-, family- and school variables.<br>I work from Europe (Netherlands and Spain) but can serve clients around the globe. Languages are English or Dutch.
